scenarioDescription:
The OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L Exoplanetary System


Overview

OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L is a star with 0.04 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 24429.08 light years away from the solar system.

OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L system


OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L b

OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L b was discovered by the OGLE observatory, in 2018-05, using the microlensing method. Its semi-major axis is 0.59 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L b is 238.500 times the mass of Earth. The radius of OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L b is 14.000 that of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the OGLE.
name: OGLE-2017-BLG-1522L - System With 1 Exoplanet
